====== CSV Conversion Recipe ======
This recipe outlines how to use Sync Tools to convert a  set of files to CSV on a **Windows computer** and steps through the process of install a unix environment, installing the scripts, and running the conversion. 

===== Setup for Windows: Python and Git =====

Download the latest Python Windows Installer from [[http://www.python.org/download/]] and run through the install process. When offered the option to Customise Python during the install, choose to 'Add python.exe to Path'. 

Install Git for windows from [[http://msysgit.github.com/]] and during install choose 'Run Git from the Windows Command Prompt'.

Launch a Command Prompt from the 'Accessories' folder of the start menu.

===== Installing scripts =====

At the command prompt, run the following commands (If Cntrl-V does not work to paste in these commands, try right-click and choosing paste from the context menu).

  git clone https://github.com/aidinfolabs/IATI-XSLT.git
  git clone https://github.com/aidinfolabs/IATISyncTools.git
